ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Definitely if you want to learn what computer network is really about.

I would not recommend this course to another student, unless (s)he has a particularly strong desire to learn the subject or had some previous knowledge. I imagine that for students who really connect with the material and professor, this course would be a favorite. Unfortunately, I found the workload of the course to be so large that there was very little time to learn anything else.

I would strongly recommend this course if you have a big interest in systems and computer networks. If you are only looking for general knowledge, this course might a little too intense, especially because of the work load.
Supreme course for learning network concepts and programming practice. Take it!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Even though the topics covered don't directly relate to my research, I found that they were essential to complete my education in Computer Science, and many of the underlying principles covered are applicable to different areas as well. I learned not only about networks but also about Java and concurrent programming.
It teaches me so much about network. More importantly it teaches me there is so much I need to learn by myself.
